definitions.definition: used to emphasize the size, degree or amount of something

examples.text: The area is under threat from the sheer number of tourists using it.
We were impressed by the sheer size of the cathedral.

definitions.definition: complete and not mixed with anything else

examples.text: I only agreed out of sheer desperation.
Outside there was a sheer drop down to the sea below.

wordOrigin: adjective Middle English (in the sense ‘exempt, cleared’): probably an alteration of dialect shire ‘pure, clear’, from the Germanic base of the verb shine. In the mid 16th cent. the word was used to describe clear, pure water, and also in sense (4).
